message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atorvastatin is a lipid-lowering medication that can cause liver enzyme elevation. Flushing is a common adverse effect of niacin, lactic acidosis is associated with metformin, and rhabdomyolysis is a rare but serious adverse effect of statins.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atorvastatin is a statin medication used to lower cholesterol levels. The most common adverse effect of statins is elevated liver enzymes. Flushing, lactic acidosis, and rhabdomyolysis are less common adverse effects.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atorvastatin is a statin medication used to lower cholesterol levels. The most common adverse effect of statins is elevated liver enzymes. Flushing and myalgias are also possible adverse effects, but less common than elevated liver enzymes. Lactic acidosis is a rare adverse effect associated with the use of metformin. Rhabdomyolysis is a rare but serious adverse effect that can occur with the use of statins, especially at high doses or when used in combination with other medications, but it is not the most common adverse effect.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atorvastatin is a commonly used medication to treat high cholesterol. The most common adverse effect is elevated liver enzymes, which is monitored by blood tests. Flushing and lactic acidosis are rare side effects. Rhabdomyolysis is a serious but rare adverse effect that can cause muscle breakdown and kidney damage.
